Name: Cardiology
Description: Cardiology is the medical specialty dealing with disorders of the heart and blood vessels. Cardiologists diagnose and treat conditions like heart attacks, arrhythmias, and hypertension.

Name: Angioplasty
Description: Angioplasty is a minimally invasive procedure used to open blocked or narrowed blood vessels of the heart. It's commonly performed to restore blood flow in coronary arteries.

Name: Dermatology
Description: Dermatology focuses on the diagnosis and treatment of skin, hair, and nail disorders. Dermatologists treat conditions like acne, eczema, psoriasis, and skin cancers.

Name: Pediatrics
Description: Pediatrics is the branch of medicine that involves the medical care of infants, children, and adolescents. Pediatricians manage a wide range of childhood illnesses and developmental concerns.

Name: Neurology
Description: Neurology is the specialty concerned with disorders of the nervous system, including the brain, spinal cord, and nerves. Neurologists treat conditions like epilepsy, stroke, and multiple sclerosis.

Name: Orthopedics
Description: Orthopedics focuses on the musculoskeletal system, including bones, joints, muscles, ligaments, and tendons. Orthopedic surgeons treat injuries and conditions such as fractures and arthritis.

Name: Ophthalmology
Description: Ophthalmology deals with the diagnosis and treatment of eye diseases and vision problems. Ophthalmologists perform eye exams, prescribe lenses, and conduct eye surgeries.

Name: Gastroenterology
Description: Gastroenterology is the branch of medicine focused on the digestive system and its disorders. Gastroenterologists treat conditions like ulcers, irritable bowel syndrome, and hepatitis.

Name: Endocrinology
Description: Endocrinology involves the study of hormone-related diseases. Endocrinologists manage conditions such as diabetes, thyroid disorders, and hormonal imbalances.

Name: Urology
Description: Urology focuses on the urinary tract system and the male reproductive organs. Urologists treat conditions like kidney stones, urinary infections, and prostate issues.

Name: Dentistry
Description: Dentistry is the branch of medicine dealing with oral health. Dentists diagnose and treat issues related to the teeth, gums, and mouth, including cavities, gum disease, and tooth alignment.
